html:
Just you and your music.

There's no reason why your music player also has to do 10 other things. Why not just focus on one thing and do it well? Designer Tyler Murphy and I built Sonora on that philosophy.

Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

Sonora is where I learned that less is truly more. By removing everything that was not an integral part of experiencing music, we ended up with a product that felt far more refined. Reducing complexity allowed us to focus on the key elements that truly mattered.

The two main focuses were the album grid and the centralized queue. The grid was the Core Animation-backed crown jewel of the app. Lots of performance optimization went into ensuring that it scrolled smoothly.

The queue challenged us to build a centralized control for controlling playback while keeping with our philosophy of minimalism. So many little interactions and gestures were implemented to make it simple yet powerful.

“Sonora isn't just a barebones music player. It's thoughtful, elegant, and minimalistic.”

— Scott Danielson, Mac.AppStorm

The end of the road.

All good things must come to and end, and Tyler and I were too busy with our lives to continue working on Sonora. The good news is that Sonora is now an open source project so that someone else can hopefully continue building on what we started.
